data.title: WATCH: Rick Moranis 'returns' to acting and appears with Ryan Reynolds in ad
data.meta_description: Rick Moranis has finally broken a 13-year acting hiatus to star opposite Ryan Reynolds in a new commercial.
data.text:
Rick Moranis has finally broken a 13-year acting hiatus to star opposite Ryan Reynolds in a new commercial.

One of the biggest names in acting for a generation was Rick Moranis, so it's only natural that people of a certain age would 'fan-boy' over the return of the actor, albeit for a 30-second advertisement.

Starring alongside Hollywood superstar Ryan Reynolds, Moranis stunned fans following a hiatus that spanned two-decade hiatus.

Fans are also excited to hear that, Moranis has signed on to reprise his role as Wayne Szalinski in Shrunk, a new sequel in the Honey, I Shrunk the Kids series. When completed, it will mark a return to live-action films for Moranis after a 23-year hiatus.

You can watch the acting stint below.

"So, what do you want me to do? You want me to say something about Mint?" Moranis asks after Reynolds introduces him. "I've really got to get a phone."

Reynolds later admits he simply brought Moranis into the fold because he's "a huge fan." The two share an awkward stare before Moranis promptly exits.

Image from Getty.

Moranis had previously left his Hollywood life after the death of his wife, costume designer Ann Belsky in 1991. Moranis slowly withdrew from his acting career to focus on life as a single parent.

In the years since he has starred as a voice actor in a smattering of animated projects and TV specials, with his most recent on-screen acting role was in 2007, for the Bob & Doug McKenzie's Two-Four Anniversary TV special.

Image from Getty.

He was perhaps best known for his roles in blockbusters including 'Ghostbusters', 'Honey, I shrunk the kids' and the Mel Brooks spoof 'Spaceballs'.
